1.text: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;

2.text: For kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

3.text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior;

4.text: Who will have all men to be saved, and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

5.text: For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

6.text: Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.

7.text: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, and lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.

8.text: I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.

9.text: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with modesty and sobriety; not with braided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

10.text: But (which becomes women professing godliness) with good works.

11.text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

12.text: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.

13.text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

14.text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

15.text: Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.
